text:
Today I'm so excited because we're learning 
English with The Friends Reunion! I've always been

a huge fan of the series so much so that I can 
predict the lines when watching random episodes.

Can you believe that since the show ended 17 years 
ago the six lead characters had only seen each

other all together one time? So this was a long 
awaited reunion and it did not disappoint. If you

haven't yet watched it don't worry there aren't 
any spoilers in this lesson and I want to let you

know in case you're new here that every week we 
make lessons just like this one to help you learn

fast English without getting lost, without missing 
the jokes and without subtitles. Just like this

fan who says that our lessons have improved their 
vocabulary so much! So make sure you subscribe by

hitting the button and the bell down below 
to continue learning with us now! I hope you

enjoyed this lesson as much as I enjoyed watching 
the reunion. Let's watch the first scene now.

To be there for someone is to be available to 
provide support by listening comforting or helping

when the person needs it. I wonder if you remember 
where you've heard this expression before.

Yes! That's right! The famous opening song 
of the sitcom "I'll be there for you". Not

only its theme song but as you've seen 
the whole series features pronunciation

vocabulary and expressions we use in real life 
like many learners from all around the world

Friends was an important part of their English 
learning journey. To help you learn English

in a fun and natural way we created the Fluent 
with Friends course. When you join this course

you'll learn real native vocabulary and also 
become part of a community of global learners

who'll also be there for you. You can try it 
right now with our completely free Masterclass.

That's right completely free! Just click on 
the link down below or up here to sign up!

So many of you from our community have told 
me that our lessons help you a lot with
your listening, vocabulary and even pronunciation.

But that you're still frustrated because you don't 
have many opportunities to practice speaking.

Well to help you with this frustration we 
created the RealLife App. At the touch of

a button you can connect to other learners from 
around the world and practice your speaking while

discovering other cultures in fun and dynamic 
short conversations and guess what it's absolutely

free! So download it now by clicking the link down 
in the description or just search for the RealLife

English App in the Apple App Store or the Google 
Play Store. I look forward to seeing you there!
